title: Alesso and Sentinel Channel Raw Emotion on Thunderous New Single "Freedom"
description: Unveiled after months of mainstage anticipation, "Freedom" blends Alesso's shadowy intensity with Sentinel's kinetic energy for a high-voltage release built to move bodies.
author: Ansh Talim
excerpt: Unveiled after months of mainstage anticipation, "Freedom" blends Alesso's shadowy intensity with Sentinel's kinetic energy for a high-voltage release built to move bodies.
siteName: EDM.com - The Latest Electronic Dance Music News, Reviews & Artists

html:
Unveiled after months of main stage anticipation, "Freedom" blends Alesso's shadowy intensity with Sentinel's kinetic energy for a high-voltage release built to move bodies.

c/o Insomniac Events

Unveiled after months of main stage anticipation, "Freedom" blends Alesso's shadowy intensity with Sentinel's kinetic energy for a high-voltage release built to move bodies.

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

After months of teasing it on the world’s biggest stages, Alesso has finally released "Freedom," his new collaboration with Australian trio Sentinel today. The track is out now via Alesso's label BodyHi.

Alesso has included the track in his Ultra Music Festival, EDC Las Vegas, and most recently, his World DJ Festival sets, proving that "Freedom" already had momentum before it ever hit streaming platforms.

"'Freedom' has been such a powerful record to play out over the last couple of months, it goes off every time," said Alesso. "I've loved collaborating with the Sentinel boys on this one, and I'm excited about what we'll create together next."

The single opens with a high-voltage surge and never lets off. Its pacing is relentless with sharp percussion, a snarling synth lead, and a vocal hook that drives the lyrics "I need freedom" throughout the song. Alesso's production is reminiscent of the aggressive energy found in tracks like "Dark," while Sentinel balances it with an upbeat drive, adding grit and keeping the arrangement tight and focused.

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

"With Freedom, we were excited to explore making a track built purely for the dance floor. There's an energy in this song that's felt so fresh yet nostalgic since day one. Since first collaborating with Alesso back in 2022, we've always shared a clear, unified vision for our music — and we're thrilled to be teaming up again for the next chapter in the story of Sentinel, Alesso, and Body Hi."

You can listen to "Freedom" below and find the new release on streaming platforms here.
